data.content:
adjective
US
exactly correct
Her assessment of the situation was right on.
b informal + somewhat old-fashioned - used to say that you agree completely with what someone has said
Make love, not war! Right on, man!
usually right-on [more ~; most ~] chiefly Brit informal + sometimes disapproving :having or supporting liberal or left-wing beliefs and opinions about how people should be treated
one of the right-on people
